_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The employees of Crop Production Service, West Isle Production, 3201 Avenue 54, Alpaugh, California, are committed to the prevention of a release of Anhydrous Ammonia that is stored and handled at the facility.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility will work with the local fire department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.  An emergency response plan has been developed and would be implemented in the event of a release.

2. Facility Information

The following activities occur at the facility:

a. Blending and storage of mixed grade fertilizers for use as crop production nutrients
b. The production of Ammonium Polyphosphate and Zinc Chelate fertilizers
c. Receiving and storage of Anhydrous Ammonia.  Anhydrous Ammonia is received by rail tank car and stored in two 30,000-gallon capacity aboveground storage tanks.


3. Accidental Release Prevention Program 

West Isle Production has comprehensive written programs and procedures to comply with the CalARP program regulations.  Facility management and employees involved in the covered process are trained and aware of their responsibilities to implement the
CalARP Program requirements.

4.  Five-Year Accident History 

In the past five years, there has been no release of Anhydrous Ammonia that has caused any deaths, injuries or property damage at the facility nor resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage or environmental damage.

5. The Emergency Response Program

The facility has incorporated provisions of the following regulations in their emergency plan:
? OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38
? OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120
? Section 25503, Division 6

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety is an on-going process at this facility.  Inspections and audits are conducted periodically to determine how well the facility is in compliance w
ith regulatory and company requirements.  At the time of this update, there was one  risk reduction measure being considered for implementation by facility management.
